definition: a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
dog/CL:隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]
urgent/pressing/rapid/hurried/worried/to make (sb) anxious
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
wall/CL:面[mian4],堵[du3]
variant of 牆|墙[qiang2], wall

sentences.english: When cornered, a horse will fight, and its feet and hooves can be deadly.
sentences.chinese: 当狗急跳墙，马会出局，它的脚蹄可以致命。

definition: lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
to burn both jade and common stone/to destroy indiscriminately (idiom)
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
harboring unfathomable motives (idiom)
to make a false countercharge
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
lit. to nurture a tiger invites calamity/fig. to indulge one's enemy is asking for trouble (idiom)
to invite trouble
to submit/to give in
